# Cambridge IGCSE™

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 214, 905, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 178, 292]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0625/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 299, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Theory (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 729, 651]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
The car decelerates from \(13.0 \text{m / s}\) to \(0 \text{m / s}\) at a constant deceleration. The mass of the car is \(1350 \text{kg}\). The car travels \(13 \text{m}\) in \(2.0 \text{s}\) as it decelerates.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 116, 826, 135]]<|/det|>
Show that the work done by the car as it decelerates is approximately \(1.1 \times 10^5 \text{J}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 336, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 367, 148, 386]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 367, 920, 400]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 413, 717, 432]]<|/det|>
Suggest and explain what causes the stopping distance to increase.
